TopicTitle: What Do You Think KSP 1.8 Will Add?

Articles.Content: So, what do you think the big feature of the upcoming KSP 1.8 update will be? 1.6 was a delta-v calculator and delta-v showing up in staging, 1.7 was a better and more precise manuever making system, called Room to Maneuver. So, what do you think 1.8 will be?
Proper docking GUI.

Maybe some sort of editor tools for better craft building, like various measurement helpers, XRay, angle helpers, CoM/Thrust vector/Lift vector position readouts, staged CoM/thrust vector/lift vector. Because reasons.
I don’t know, we have no way of knowing until SQUAD makes an announcement. I hope it’ll be something that obiviates one of my mods, like the main features of 1.6 and 1.7 did, and works well.
Chocolate snacks

Yea.  I feel that LifeSupport is not going to be too far away.

Good background processing is what I dream for currently.  So many mods useful and extending mods are facing issues around high timewarp.

Peace.
This discussion of the game's development has been moved to Development Discussions.
I suspect that KSP version 1.8 will add bugs to make up for all the good features added in 1.7.
Well they did 2 mods I considered required, and don't even use anymore (KER and PreciseNode) so the obvious new feature would be something like KAC.

Quote

KAC

Quote

docking GUI

KSP 1.8.0: Clock & Dock!

Edited August 3, 2019 by kerbiloid

4 hours ago, kerbiloid said:

KSP 1.8.0: Clock & Dock!

...

Yes. That is a fantastic name for an update.

SQUAD, please hire this man.
I hope they continue the old part remodeling. Been thinking yesterday that the Swivel, Reliant and Thumper are in need of a Terrier-style facelift.

2 hours ago, Fraktal said:

I hope they continue the old part remodeling. Been thinking yesterday that the Swivel, Reliant and Thumper are in need of a Terrier-style facelift.

Oh please no. Leave the parts alone. They are fine, at most they need a touch up. I'd rather they do new models, but keep the parts looking much the same.

They should be doing something that will improve the game, not pointless changes. If they do anything with the parts, they should add more variants, in particular, adding some character back to parts they took it away from.

Like the decouplers. All the decouplers look the same now, and you can't just pick which is which at a glance.

Edited August 3, 2019 by Tw1

story mode? "kerstronomers have discovered an asteroid on a collision course! you have xx years to intercept it and save kermanity!"

ai competitors in career mode?

factorio meets ksp? "so you wanna launch a rocket eh?, better start by making some iron plates..."

kerbdew valley? the ultimate marshmallow farming simulator ON MINMUS! 

...

actually i'd just be happy if the aero model got updated a little so that tubes worked and attachment-point-fu was no longer required for aerodynamically shaped craft
I don’t know, but I hope for better aerodynamics in KSP.

5 hours ago, Blasty McBlastblast said:

story mode? "kerstronomers have discovered an asteroid on a collision course! you have xx years to intercept it and save kermanity!"

ai compet﻿itors in career mode﻿?

Story mode:

This will be interesting but when it collides, the game will be over?

Story mode is the best when there are ai Competitors in example on Laythe, they looking for Life in Space and when you upgrade your Tracking Station they detect Signals from Kerbin and check it out. And the first contact with you and the ai will define if you get friends and explore togeter or the ai will fight you (you can transmit Information and can get information from the AI Kerbals, but think what you transmit and what not). In Example: Landing on Laythe before you have contact wil be a invasion of Kerbin Kerbals, and the Laythe Kerbals will fight again the player.

 

(I serached for a mod 1.3.0 that adds AI Kerbals on other planets, but i dont find anyone)

Edited August 3, 2019 by SwissSpace93

At this point, all i expect from 1.8 is adding version number 1.8 to the main menu screen.

I've been waiting for 1.8 for months now dammit! BG is good, but i've been tricked!

Hope someday we will get functional IVAs. I use a mod for it but it will be so cool for it to be stock... It's nice to drive planes and rockets pov-style with my HOTAS

Link for the mod if anyones interested

On 8/3/2019 at 1:54 AM, kerbiloid said:

KSP 1.8.0: Clock & Dock!

YES!!!!!!!
I would just like the summon the kraken button.
Clouds / atmospheric effects would be nice and a revamp of the last engine and tank parts, just to move away from KSP being an ongoing construction site.

On 8/3/2019 at 12:27 PM, Fraktal said:

I hope they continue the old part remodeling. Been thinking yesterday that the Swivel, Reliant and Thumper are in need of a Terrier-style facelift.

I wish they'd just hire the folks working on the Restock mod & replace everything stock with their work.

On 8/3/2019 at 3:03 PM, Xurkitree said:

 

I've been waiting for 1.8 for months now dammit!

Why?

  • 1.4 March 2018
  • 1.5 October 2018
  • 1.6 December 2018
  • 1.7 April 2019

Based on last summer you can expect 1.9 in November. Based on the average of the last 3 gaps, you could expect it in August, this month. The only way you could have expected it earlier was to see the 2-month gap between 1.5 and 1.6 and thought that was the norm, which it clearly is not.
I'm betting Squad will expand the usage of the new inventory system that we saw introduced in the last update. It's in there now, but not fully exploited yet. There's some more potential there.

If history is any guide, probably nothing I care about. DLC probably.
I care about bugs and performance, not DLC, part revamps, or adding functionality that already exists in well-established mods. Frankly, everything since 1.3.1 has been a disappointment.

Aerodynamics overhaul? FAR is better.
Comnet? RemoteTech is better.
EVA chutes? Already had 'em.
Part variants? We already have at least 3 part-switchers that are more flexible.
Inventory system? KIS beats it hands-down.
Part overhauls? ReStock leaves it for dead, just like PorkJet and Ven did so long ago.
Steam integration? Screw steam, we have community craft-sharing already.
"Support for controllers" in 1.4? This must be a joke, right? 1.4 broke controller support completely. We already had AFBW anyway.
Improved burn time information? BetterBurnTime has been a thing for years.
ΔV readouts? KER is better and faster.
Ability to remove helmets and neck rings? *cough* TextureReplacer. Way better.
Maneuver Mode? Nope, going to keep using Maneuver Node Evolved, because it's better.

The only things mods can't fix - i.e. performance, game-engine bugs, and physics jank - Squad isn't doing anything about.
